metadata.feature_description: Extracts searchable content from documents using IFilter providers for PDF and Office files.

steps.action: Navigate to Site Settings > Search > File Extensions tab
steps.expected: File Extensions configuration page displays with IFilter provider information
steps.actual: File Extensions tab displayed showing Included File Extensions with FILE EXTENSION, FILE TYPE, and CONTENT CRAWLING columns

steps.action: Review configured file extensions and their IFilter providers
steps.expected: Configured file extensions show their associated IFilter provider names
steps.actual: File extensions displayed with IFilter providers: .doc (Microsoft Office Filter), .docx (Wordpad DOCX Filter), .ppt (Microsoft Office Filter), .xls (Microsoft Office Filter)

steps.expected: .doc shows IFilter provider with content crawling enabled
steps.actual: .doc displays 'Microsoft Office Filter' with content crawling checkbox enabled

steps.expected: .docx shows IFilter provider with content crawling enabled
steps.actual: .docx displays 'Wordpad DOCX Filter' with content crawling checkbox enabled

steps.expected: .xls shows IFilter provider with content crawling enabled
steps.actual: .xls displays 'Microsoft Office Filter' with content crawling checkbox enabled

issues: .xlsx file extension was not configured in the included file extensions list

steps.expected: .ppt shows IFilter provider with content crawling enabled
steps.actual: .ppt displays 'Microsoft Office Filter' with content crawling checkbox enabled
.pptx displays warning icon with 'Content crawling is unavailable' - indicating no IFilter provider is installed for .pptx on this system

issues: .pptx IFilter provider not installed on this Windows system - this is an environment configuration issue, not a code defect

steps.action: Click 'Add File Type' button in Included File Extensions section
steps.expected: Add file type form appears with text input field
steps.actual: Form appeared with 'File Extension' text input and Cancel/Save buttons

steps.expected: PDF file extension is added to the list
steps.actual: .pdf was successfully added to the Included File Extensions list

steps.expected: System detects IFilter availability for PDF
steps.actual: .pdf shows warning icon with 'Content crawling is unavailable' - correctly indicating no PDF IFilter is installed on this Windows system

steps.action: Observe behavior for file types without IFilter providers
steps.expected: System clearly indicates when content extraction is unavailable
steps.actual: File types without IFilter providers (.pptx, .pdf) display a warning icon and 'Content crawling is unavailable' message in the Content Crawling column

steps.action: Hover over warning icon to see tooltip
steps.actual: Tooltip displays 'Content crawling is unavailable.' message

observations: The IFilter Document Content Extraction configuration is accessible via Admin > Site Settings > Search > File Extensions tab
The system correctly detects installed Windows IFilter providers at the OS level
File types with installed IFilters (.doc, .docx, .ppt, .xls) show their provider name and enabled content crawling
File types without installed IFilters (.pptx, .pdf) correctly show 'Content crawling is unavailable' with a warning icon
PDF IFilter is not installed on this test system - Adobe PDF IFilter or similar would need to be installed for PDF content extraction
.pptx IFilter is not installed on this test system - Microsoft Office 2010 Filter Pack or later would provide this capability
.xlsx file extension was not in the default included file extensions list
The actual document content extraction occurs during the search crawler scheduled task (backend process), not in real-time through the UI
Code review shows FilterReader.cs uses Windows IFilter COM interfaces, DocxToText.cs provides native .docx parsing without IFilter dependency
